pr_title: IBM FHIR Server audit does not log bundles correctly. #1803

timeline.message:
IBM FHIR Server audit does not log bundles correctly. #1803

Signed-off-by: Paul Bastide <pbastide@us.ibm.com>

timeline.bodyText: I know it's not part of the change, but is this the best way to get the name of the host? Do we ensure that HOSTNAME is part of the environment?  On Windows, COMPUTERNAME might be more appropriate. Let me know if you think we need a ticket for this.
timeline.author: punktilious
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -82,7 +82,7 @@
     private static CadfResource observerRsrc =
             new CadfResource.Builder("fhir-server", ResourceType.compute_node)
                             .geolocation(new CadfGeolocation.Builder(geoCity, geoState, geoCountry, null).build())
-                            .name("Fhir Audit")
+                            .name("IBM FHIR Server - Audit")
                             .host(System.getenv("HOSTNAME"))

replies.bodyText: Good point, I don't think it's super reliable. I think a ticket isn't bad, probably lower priority.
replies.author: prb112

timeline.author: punktilious

replies.bodyText: Cleaned this up by addressing Lee's well-known request
replies.author: prb112

timeline.message:
fix: per code review changed the compare, and added an additional ignore
for the metadata endpoints

Signed-off-by: Paul Bastide <pbastide@us.ibm.com>

timeline.author: lmsurpre

timeline.message:
Update fhir-server/src/main/java/com/ibm/fhir/server/util/RestAuditLogger.java
